document.topic_text: Phelps ready to spend more time with son Boomer Michael Phelps on preparing for his Olympic return in Rio. USA TODAY Sports Alec McQuade, WXIA 10:31 PM. EDT August 11, 2016 TOPSHOT - USA's Michael Phelps (L) holds his son Boomer after he won the Men's 200m Butterfly Final during the swimming event at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 9, 2016. / AFP / Martin BUREAU (Photo credit should read MARTIN BUREAU/AFP/Getty Images) (Photo: MARTIN BUREAU, This content is subject to copyright.) Michael Phelps is nearing the end of his Olympic career, so he says. We've heard that before, but this time it is probably for real. When Phelps won the 21st Gold medal of his Olympic career by winning the 200-meter butterfly Tuesday, Phelps went over to his family in the stands to celebrate. He had a moment with his mother, Deborah, like we have seen so many times throughout the years. Her face filled with joy as she gave him a kiss. But then, there was another moment. One we had never seen before reminding us that Phelps is now all grown up. The moment with his son, Boomer. Phelps' fianc√©, Nicole, held Boomer out to him, and he gave him a kiss. It was a moment that makes Phelps emotional, now, whenever he thinks about it. "You're going to bring tears to my eyes," Phelps said in an interview with NBC Wednesday when bringing up the moment. "I want to be with him more. So being able to share that one moment that I had with him, definitely very special," he said with his voice quivering. The cameras were everywhere while Phelps embraced Boomer. There are pictures of that moment from just about every angle imaginable. Phelps wants some copies. "Looking forward to seeing more photos of that." Here you go, Phelps. Enjoy: PHOTOS | Phelps special moment with Boomer Loading...
